column4: hello, guys! i istalled xubuntu-desktop and now i want to remove it. is just "sudo apt-get remove xubuntu-desktop" enough?
its just a metapackage...you have to remove all packages that came with it!
its more complicated than it sounds!..
isn't there some dependencies rules to catch all the packages and don't hurt gnome?
you have to pin-point the part in the logs where you started the xfce install...you have synaptic?
Synaptic Package Manager, yes i do.
ok..then in synaptic theres a history section...use that to find all packages that were installed along with  xubuntu-desktop
[http://www.linuxine.com/2008/07/howto-install-remove-gnome-kdexfc-in-ubuntu.html] they said "sudo apt-get autoremove xubuntu-desktop xfce" is it wrong?
the way i suggested will ensure you removed all packages...that will be in history all under one timestamp
http://pastebin.com/xNeF9tDS is that i'm looking for? its actually 5 lines and the "Install:" section is probably i want to remove every single package, right?
looks like it....but also confirm in synaptic
it seems that the history in synaptic is empty.
looks like this was a command line before?
actually yes, sorry if i mislead you.
and yeah..if you installed via command line...synaptic wont have the history..my bad
okay thank you for your time! i hope don't broke something.
i honestly feel a reinstall will be the best/fastest way to get rid of the DE,,,if thats feasible!
